sentences.english: When someone disagrees with you or offends you, don't lose your temper. Why? Because it is of no use to do so.
sentences.chinese: 当有人和你意见不同或开罪你的时候，事实上四十二。

sentences.english: You forgive those who have done you wrong. You always give people a second chance.
sentences.chinese: 你宽恕那些开罪你的人，也经常给别人第二次机会。

sentences.english: Maybe they can't afford to confront their sponsors openly.
sentences.chinese: 也许是开罪不起他们的赞助者。

sentences.english: B:Maybe they can't afford to confront their sponsors openly.
sentences.chinese: 也许是开罪不起他们的赞助者。

sentences.english: I would forgive my friends that used to do wrong to me.
sentences.chinese: 我会原谅那些曾经开罪我的朋友。

sentences.english: But the gods are offended by hubris.
sentences.chinese: 但是，极度的高傲自信开罪了神灵。

sentences.english: When someone disagrees with you or offends you, don't lose your temper.
sentences.chinese: 当有人和你意见不同或开罪了你，不要失去你的脾气。
